(M) 767.30^7^ December, 1944.WAR CABINET.APPLICATIONS FOR RELEASE FROM THE ARMED FORCES.Directive by the Prime Mimister and Minister of Defence.MY attention has been called to the pressure that is being exerted upon theService Departments and the Ministry of Labour to release men from the forces for industrial purposes.All Departments should realise that the demands of the Services forman-power are at present heavy and will be heavier still in the New Year. Inthe present stage of the war it is only in the most exceptional circumstances that men can be released.Departments should bear this in mind when scrutinising applications, andshould, until further notice, decline to sponsor proposals for release unless theyare imperatively necessary in the interests of the war effort. The only exceptionthat can be made is for a limited number of specialists for housing.W. S. C.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,30th December, 1944.[-28921]
